name: Rumtek Monastery
description: Rumtek Monastery, officially known as the Dharma Chakra Centre, is the largest monastery in Sikkim and serves as the seat of the Karmapa. This magnificent structure is a perfect replica of the original Tsurphu Monastery in Tibet.

name: Pemayangtse Monastery
description: One of the oldest and most important monasteries in Sikkim, Pemayangtse was built in 1705. It houses a remarkable seven-tiered wooden sculpture depicting the celestial palace of Guru Rinpoche.

name: Tashiding Monastery
description: Built in 1641, Tashiding is considered one of the most sacred monasteries in Sikkim. The monastery is famous for its annual Bhumchu festival where holy water is blessed.
